intro: Lobelia volkensii, commonly known as the East African lobelia, is a striking perennial herb native to the highlands of East Africa. It is characterized by its vibrant blue to purple flowers, which bloom in clusters during the rainy season. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
